page.title: 03History of Kirtlington part2
page.content: Local History - At Northbrook there is a brick built dovecot which together with a walled garden is all that remains of the Manor House. The main house in Kirtlington being built between 1741 and 1748, when it was owned by the Dashwood family. During the Civil War soldiers from both sides were billeted in the village. The first Post Office was opened in 1815 and it is known that during the 18th Century shops, blacksmiths, bakers, a dairy, a jewellers and many public houses existed in the village. Prior to 1811 farmers owned various small strips of land scattered over the village. The Land Inclosure Act of 1815 forced farmers to exchange pieces of land to create larger areas and thus make farming more convenient. Kirtlington is mentioned in records as early as 977.
